title: Volkswagen braces for showdown with unions after warning of possible German plant closures
content: Volkswagen's management is expected to lay out their cost-cutting plans to about 18,000 workers at a town hall meeting in Wolfsburg on Wednesday.
summary: Volkswagen's management is expected to lay out their cost-cutting plans to about 18,000 workers at a town hall meeting in Wolfsburg on Wednesday.

title: Starlink in Brazil's crosshairs as spat over Elon Musk's X escalates
content: The confrontation between Brazil and Musk continues to escalate over the country's decision to block his social media company X.
summary: The confrontation between Brazil and Musk continues to escalate over the country's decision to block his social media company X.

title: Mongolia was meant to arrest Russia's President Putin last night. It didn't, and now it's in trouble
content: Mongolia, as a member of the International Criminal Court, should have arrested the Russian president as soon as he landed on Mongolian soil Monday evening.
summary: Mongolia, as a member of the International Criminal Court, should have arrested the Russian president as soon as he landed on Mongolian soil Monday evening.

title: Tesla Cybertruck is in a category of its own for better or worse
content: The Cybertruck, which in many ways is more "cyber" than "truck," has created a new segment in the automotive industry that it solely holds.
summary: The Cybertruck, which in many ways is more "cyber" than "truck," has created a new segment in the automotive industry that it solely holds.

title: Klarna rival Zilch posts first profit and appoints ex-Aviva CEO to board ahead of IPO
content: Philip Belamant, Zilch's CEO, told CNBC the firm was able to hit profitability by growing rather than cutting back like other fintechs have done.
summary: Philip Belamant, Zilch's CEO, told CNBC the firm was able to hit profitability by growing rather than cutting back like other fintechs have done.

title: Rolls-Royce shares rise after Cathay Pacific says A350 engine issue affects limited flights
content: Cathay Pacific has identified an engine component failure in 15 of its A350 aircraft, a long-range, wide-body which uses Rolls-Royce engines.
summary: Cathay Pacific has identified an engine component failure in 15 of its A350 aircraft, a long-range, wide-body which uses Rolls-Royce engines.

title: Russia signals its official stance on using nuclear weapons is about to change, accusing the West of 'escalation'

summary: Russia has again hinted that it is making changes to its official policy on the use of nuclear weapons, as Ukraine's incursion into the Kursk region continues.

title: China's property woes and U.S. sanctions have hit some cities hard

title: China's first global gaming hit sells millions in a week. An early investor shares what's next
content: China's first attempt at a top-tier video game has smashed world records, bolstering the industry's global ambitions after Beijing's gaming crackdown.

title: First France, now South Korea — Telegram's legal troubles are only growing. Here's why
content: Telegram is facing a probe in South Korea, where police suspect it of helping spread illicit deepfake porn, adding to the platform's mounting legal troubles.
summary: Telegram is facing a probe in South Korea, where police suspect it of helping spread illicit deepfake porn, adding to the platform's mounting legal troubles.

title: JPMorgan economist says China's housing market crash is still not over
content: China's troubled housing market could see prolonged softness, as a slew of government stimulus and supportive measures have not been "satisfactory."
summary: China's troubled housing market could see prolonged softness, as a slew of government stimulus and supportive measures have not been "satisfactory."

title: Chinese consumer brands look to crack the global market with Singapore as a testbed
content: Chinese consumer brands are using Singapore as a cultural testbed in their push to build an international business.

title: Why does Couche-Tard want to buy 7-Eleven? It's a 'cheap' stock, says portfolio manager

summary: There is little to improve in Seven & i's core business, but the company is cheaper than global counterparts, Comgest's Kaye said.

title: 'Golden era' for Hong Kong retail is over as Chinese tourists continue to tighten their purse strings
content: Real estate analysts claimed that the shopping frenzy the city once experienced will not return "for a long, long time."

title: Asia-Pacific markets mostly fall after South Korea's inflation rate hits 42-month low
content: South Korea's headline inflation for August eased to 2% form 2.6%, its lowest level since March 2021
summary: South Korea's headline inflation for August eased to 2% form 2.6%, its lowest level since March 2021

title: Huawei looks to upstage Apple with product launch just hours after expected iPhone 16 unveiling

title: CNBC Daily Open: Bitcoin isn’t really a currency (yet)
content: In my head, bitcoin is pretty pebbles exchanged among enthusiasts. But no one's really using it to buy other goods.
summary: In my head, bitcoin is pretty pebbles exchanged among enthusiasts. But no one's really using it to buy other goods.

title: Is the Fed 'sleepwalking into a policy mistake?': Abrdn analyst calls for faster easing of rates

title: American demand for international trips drives 'travel momentum' and overall spending
content: Americans' spending on international trips has underpinned overall travel strength.

title: Weight loss drugs cut Covid-19 deaths, study finds
content: Fewer deaths and negative health outcomes were identified in patients with chronic kidney disease and who caught Covid-19 after treatment with semaglutide.
summary: Fewer deaths and negative health outcomes were identified in patients with chronic kidney disease and who caught Covid-19 after treatment with semaglutide.

title: UK suspends some arms export licenses to Israel
content: British Foreign Minister David Lammy said Monday that the country would immediately suspend some arms export licenses to Israel.
summary: British Foreign Minister David Lammy said Monday that the country would immediately suspend some arms export licenses to Israel.

title: Germany's fragile coalition dealt fresh blow as far right lands first state win since World War II
content: After Germany's far-right AfD recorded successes in state elections, the path ahead could be tricky for the national government around Chancellor Olaf Scholz.
summary: After Germany's far-right AfD recorded successes in state elections, the path ahead could be tricky for the national government around Chancellor Olaf Scholz.

title: Macao did it. Singapore too. Now Thailand looks to build casinos to attract tourist dollars
content: If the law gets passed, Thailand could be Macao and Singapore's largest competitor by the end of the decade, industry watchers told CNBC.

title: Volkswagen warns of plant closures in Germany, citing ‘extremely tense’ situation
content: Volkswagen on Monday warned it will no longer be able to rule out plant closures in Germany.

title: China's manufacturing output swung back to modest growth in August, private survey finds
content: China's factory activity has shown modest growth among smaller manufacturers, as exporting orders offset the weakening domestic consumption.

title: X blocked in Brazil after supreme court panel upholds suspension order
content: A panel of Brazil's federal supreme court justices voted unanimously to uphold orders suspending the use of Elon Musk's social network X nationwide there.

title: Rupert Murdoch's property group considers bid for UK's Rightmove, sending shares 21% higher
content: Rupert Murdoch-owned REA Group said Monday it is contemplating a takeover offer for U.K. property portal Rightmove in a bid to create a global digital real estate business.
summary: Rupert Murdoch-owned REA Group said Monday it is contemplating a takeover offer for U.K. property portal Rightmove in a bid to create a global digital real estate business.
